snippet: A win would allow the candidate to extend his winning streak of Midwestern and Southern states with the help of evangelical Christians and other conservative voters.
abstract: Republican presidential candidate Rick Santorum decisively wins the Kansas caucuses with 51 percent of the vote; Mitt Romney scores victories in the Wyoming caucuses and some overseas territories. Photo (M)1
lead_paragraph: A win would allow the candidate to extend his winning streak of Midwestern and Southern states with the help of evangelical Christians and other conservative voters.

headline.main: Santorum Looks for a Win in Kansas
